Week 9: Final Project Workshop & Advanced Topics

Overview

This week weâ€™ll work on final projects and explore advanced topics based on class interests. Weâ€™ll cover emerging trends in data visualization, specialized techniques, and provide dedicated time for project development and consultation.

Learning Objectives

By the end of this week, you will be able to:

  • Apply advanced visualization techniques to final projects
  • Evaluate emerging trends and technologies in data visualization
  • Receive and incorporate feedback on work-in-progress
  • Plan and execute a comprehensive visualization project
  • Troubleshoot complex visualization challenges

Workshop Format

Tuesday: Advanced Topics Seminar

ðŸ“Š Emerging Trends in Data Visualization

Topics covered (student choice): - 3D visualization and virtual reality - Machine learning for visualization - Real-time and streaming data visualization - Collaborative and social visualization - Domain-specific visualization (scientific, business, etc.)

Thursday: Project Workshop

Individual consultations and group work time - 15-minute individual meetings with instructor - Peer collaboration and feedback - Technical troubleshooting - Design critique sessions

Final Project Requirements

Final Project

Comprehensive Data Visualization Project

Components

  1. Technical Implementation (40%)
    • Multiple linked visualizations
    • Appropriate use of interactivity
    • Clean, well-documented code
    • Professional deployment/presentation
  2. Design & Communication (30%)
    • Clear narrative and insights
    • Effective visual design
    • Accessibility compliance
    • User-centered design
  3. Process Documentation (20%)
    • Design iteration and rationale
    • Data source documentation
    • Technical challenges and solutions
    • User testing and feedback incorporation
  4. Presentation (10%)
    • 8-minute final presentation
    • Clear communication of insights
    • Demonstration of technical features
    • Q&A handling

Deliverables

  • Project Proposal: Due this week (1-2 pages)
  • Progress Check: Week 10 Tuesday
  • Final Presentation: Week 10 Thursday
  • Complete Project: Due Friday of Week 10

Readings

Required

  • Student choice from advanced topic resources
  • Peer review of project proposals

Optional

  • The Future of Data Visualization
  • Visualization Research Papers - Browse recent conference proceedings

Resources

Project Development

  • GitHub Pages - Free hosting for projects
  • Observable - Interactive notebook platform
  • Streamlit Community Cloud - App deployment

Advanced Libraries

  • D3.js - Advanced web-based visualizations
  • Three.js - 3D graphics
  • Deck.gl - Large-scale data visualization

Inspiration

  • Information is Beautiful Awards
  • Kantar Information is Beautiful
  • Visual Capitalist

Individual Consultation Topics

Come prepared to discuss: - Project scope and feasibility - Technical implementation challenges - Design decisions and alternatives - Data sources and preprocessing needs - Timeline and milestones

Pro Tip

Use this week to get unstuck on any technical challenges. Donâ€™t wait until the last minute to ask for help with complex implementations.

Important Dates
  • Project Proposal: Due Friday, 11:59 PM
  • Individual Consultations: Thursday (sign up for slot)
  • Progress Check: Next Tuesday
  • Final Presentations: Next Thursday
  • Final Projects Due: Next Friday, 11:59 PM
